meanings.definition: Represent (something) as being larger, greater, better, or worse than it actually is.
meanings.sent1: She was exaggerating the size of the fish she caught.
meanings.sent2: Stop exaggerating your accomplishments to impress others.
meanings.sent3: He kept exaggerating the number of cookies he ate, making everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: Her excitement was like a balloon exaggerating in size with each breath.
meanings.sent5: The storyteller was known for exaggerating details to make his tales more exciting.
